content.description:
This is a long boulder problem, with a few gear placements and a bolt.  

  Enjoy.
content.protection: Top Rope - Boulder Problem - Bolt and a fixed pin.
content.location: Short walk down river from the Euro Wall.

content.description: Start on Sugar frosted razor flakes, but when razor flakes moves right, continue straight up to anchor.

Left/north side of Eurowall. Start by power pole. Climb easy terrain to first bolt. Move up on large ledge. Climb flake by 2 more bolts. Next follow flake traversing right (Crux) for 2 bolts on steep terrain with bad feet. Move up to slopey hands and put your feet on the sharp flake continuing right for 2 more bolts then hard-ish big move up to jug then finally move to the anchors. Sweet line with much variety (lieback, slopers. crimps, side pulls, big moves, and an arm bar/jam). Pumpy.
content.protection: 7 bolts to shared 2 bolt anchor with Malice

content.description: Top Rope (trees) Face between Legacy and Handle with care
A fun route. The rock quality is not as bad as it looks.    Follow discontinuous and sustained lie back flakes with some clutch jams to ease the forearms. Seems longer than it is and way pumpy.

Start 20' right of Razor Flakes.   Climb up easy terrain to first bolt.   Make hard initial move (crux#1) into an under cling. Power up to pockets at second bolt. Climb through 3 or 4 powerful moves(crux#2) to small rail at 3rd bolt.   Tenuous moves follow to small flake directly above. Then make a very cool sequence of moves to the left and another flake at 4th bolt. Make 2 or 3 big moves up and right(crux #3) to juggy ledge and 5th bolt. Move right to another jug flake and get your feet on the juggy ledge and move back left then up to anchors. 

  Optionally at 5th bolt move LEFT and finish on Razor flake.

 Nice moves with some sequential, technical climbing and some burliness.
Climb straight up bolts.   Crux is thin and tricky getting steeper up high.   On steepest part there are bigger holds, but they are far apart!
content.location: This route is right of Malice

content.description: Scramble up easy slab to the business.   Climb up right side of the first bolt to slanting sharp crack/flake. Commit to face.    Make some big moves on small to non-existent holds. Find the clipping hold for the next bolt. From the last bolt make many nontrivial, but very cool moves to the anchor.   Balance and good footwork will pay great dividends.

Crazy route up slightly overhanging wall just left of large dihedral. Climb beginning of Handle with care. Move right to ledge. Continue up ridiculous blank face. Make a dynamic move to large horn to climbers right and last bolt. Move to anchors.
content.protection: This route has not been sent free nor otherwise!

content.description: Start under small pine just left of ARMageddon.    Climb steep crimps and thumb catches to pine and jugs. The route steepens a bit more here. a very cool section with a blancey mantel with no hand rest. Lie back slopey pinches to jugs and bolt. Continue up and right following discontinuous seams through another bolt and then straight up to anchor from there.

Start 10' left of Nanny Goat on ledge.   Climb crack/flake until it pinches out.   Move right to left facing small triangular alcove.   Clip and make a reachy move left to side pulls then move up to crack that goes up and right.   Move up to hard under cling (cruxy if tall) and left hand side pull to clip. Make big moves up and right (cruxy if short) then up to anchors

Climb straight up to 2nd bolt on slightly overhanging rock.   From here "wind up" and dyno (crux) to a small ledge by the 3rd bolt.   Go left at rail to 4th bolt. Hand traverse back right(pumpy, no feet - maybe heel hook) to last bolt.    Pull up to anchors.
content.protection: 5 bolts and 2 bolt anchor over top of cliff
content.location: Far right side of Euro Wall on slightly overhanging yellow/golden face.

content.description: scramble up low angle slab.   Basically climb the right facing corner.   There is hardly any stemming though.   Crux is getting to the third bolt.   The anchors are just above a small cap roof at top of route(bring slings for TR or seconding).   Or, at the next to last bolt climb left to anchors on Fus Ro Dah.
content.location: Obvious corner just right of Fus RO Dah in the middle of the cliff

content.description: Steep and thin. Routes mostly in the 12 range.   Stays dry and usually out of the wind.   Sunny all Winter.   Shady before noon and after 4:30 in summer.
